'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "arising from habit") is a major branch of [[philosophy]], is also the study of value or quality. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of what ethicality is), ''normative ethics'' (the study of what ethical truths there are and how they are known), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical knowledge).
+
'''Ethics''' (from the [[Ancient Greek]] "''ethikos''", meaning "arising from habit"), a major branch of [[philosophy]], is the study of value or quality. It covers the [[Philosophical analysis|analysis]] and employment of [[concept]]s such as [[right]], [[wrong]], [[good]], [[evil]], and [[moral responsibility|responsibility]]. It is divided into three primary areas: ''meta-ethics'' (the study of what ethicality is), ''normative ethics'' (the study of what ethical truths there are and how they are known), and ''applied ethics'' (the study of the use of ethical knowledge).
